    • Method Detail

      • create

        public static Command create(List<Command> commands)

        a help Command

      • execute

        public void execute(CommandContext context,
                    Arguments args,
                    boolean dry)
        Description copied from interface: CommandExecutor
        Runs this CommandExecutor.

        The dry parameter is important, and determines whether or not the command should actually take effect. If this is true, the command should not actually execute anything and simply declare its syntax through the Arguments object.

        CommandExceptions are ignored during dry-runs, meaning one can safely perform state checks to prevent further execution when certain conditions aren't met. Arguments must always be declared first before these checks in order for syntax harvesting to correctly function.

        Specified by:
        execute in interface CommandExecutor
        Parameters:
        context - the execution context of the command
        args - the arguments object
        dry - if the command should be dry-run
